com.xceptance.xlt.visualassertion.util

Class MaskImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.visualassertion.util.MaskImage

  • public class MaskImage
extends java.lang.Object
    Mask image that is used in the comparison of two pictures. The mask is trained with permitted differences between the two pictures, so that those difference will be ignored in the actual comparison.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage mask 
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage reference 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage referenceImage)
      Initializes the mask with the given reference image, a blank mask image is created with the dimensions of the reference image.
      MaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage referenceImage, java.awt.image.BufferedImage maskImage)
      Initializes a mask with the reference image, that is used to train it and the mask image itself.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeMask(int structureElementWidth, int structureElementHeight)
      Closes the mask to better cover an area that is allowed to be different

      Very close to markDifferences.
      void train(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, ComparisonAlgorithm algorithm, RectangleMask markerMask)
      Trains the mask on the differences between the reference and the given image with the differences calculated by the algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaskImage

        public MaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage referenceImage,
                 @Nullable
                 java.awt.image.BufferedImage maskImage)
        Initializes a mask with the reference image, that is used to train it and the mask image itself.
        Parameters:
        referenceImage - The reference image for the mask training
        maskImage - The mask image, @Nullable -> Creates a blank mask image with the dimensions of the reference image

      • MaskImage

        public MaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage referenceImage)
        Initializes the mask with the given reference image, a blank mask image is created with the dimensions of the reference image.
        Calls MaskImage(referenceImage, null)
        Parameters:
        referenceImage - The reference image for the mask training

    • Method Detail

      • getMask

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getMask()
        Returns the mask image
        Returns:
        mask image as BufferedImage

      • train

        public void train(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                  ComparisonAlgorithm algorithm,
                  RectangleMask markerMask)
        Trains the mask on the differences between the reference and the given image with the differences calculated by the algorithm. The mask already holds the reference image for comparison.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to compare the reference two
        algorithm - The algorithm that calculates the differences between the two images
        markerMask - The size of the area that will be marked around a detected difference

      • maskDifferences

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage maskDifferences(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                     java.awt.Point[] pixels,
                                                     RectangleMask markerMask,
                                                     java.awt.Color maskingColor)
        Very close to markDifferences. Goes through every pixel that was different and masks the marking block it is in, unless it was marked already. Works directly on the mask image.
        Parameters:
        pixels - pixel positions of the pixels that where detected as different
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage in which the pixels at the given positions have been marked in BLACK

      • closeMask

        public void closeMask(int structureElementWidth,
                      int structureElementHeight)
        Closes the mask to better cover an area that is allowed to be different
        Parameters:
        structureElementWidth - Width of the structure element
        structureElementHeight - Height of the structure element
